  • Constructor Details

    • SQLQuery

      public SQLQuery(Connection con, SQL sql)

  • Method Details

    • withMapper

      public SQLQuery withMapper(org.klojang.templates.NameMapper columnMapper)
      Sets the NameMapper to be used when mapping column names to be bean properties or map keys. Beware of the direction of the mappings: from column names to bean properties (or map keys).
      Parameters:
      columnMapper - The NameMapper to be used when mapping column names to bean properties or map keys.
      Returns:
      This SQLQuery instance

    • getResultSet

      public ResultSet getResultSet()
      Executes the query and returns the ResultSet produced by the JDBC driver. If the query had already been executed, the initial ResultSet is returned.
      Returns:
      The ResultSet produced by the JDBC driver

    • lookup

      public <T> T lookup(Class<T> clazz)
      Executes the query and returns the value of the first column in the first row. If the query had already been executed, you get the value from the second row, etc. Throws a KJSQLException if the query returned zero rows or if there are no more rows in the ResultSet.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the value to be returned
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class of the value to be returned
      Returns:
      The value of the first column in the first row
      Throws:
      KJSQLException - If the query returned zero rows

    • getInt

      public int getInt() throws KJSQLException
      Executes the query and returns the value of the first column in the first row as an integer. If the query had already been executed, you get the value from the second row, etc. Throws a KJSQLException if the query returned zero rows or if there are no more rows in the ResultSet.
      Returns:
      The value of the first column in the first row as an integer
      Throws:
      KJSQLException - If the query returned zero rows

    • getString

      public String getString() throws KJSQLException
      Returns the value of the first column of the first row as a String. If the query had already been executed, you get the value from the second row, etc. Throws a KJSQLException if the query returned zero rows or if there are no more rows in the ResultSet.
      Returns:
      The value of the first column of the first row as aa String
      Throws:
      KJSQLException - If the query returned zero rows

    • getList

      public <T> List<T> getList(Class<T> clazz)
      Returns a List of the all values in the first column. Equivalent to getList(clazz, 10).
      Type Parameters:
      T - The desired type of the values
      Parameters:
      clazz - The desired class of the values
      Returns:
      A List of the values of the first column in the rows selected by the query

    • getList

      public <T> List<T> getList(Class<T> clazz, int expectedSize)
      Returns a List of the all values in the first column. In other words, this method will exhaust the ResultSet.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The desired type of the values
      Parameters:
      clazz - The desired class of the values
      expectedSize - The expected number of rows
      Returns:
      A List of the values of the first column in the rows selected by the query

    • getMappifier

      public ResultSetMappifier getMappifier()
      Executes the query and returns a ResultSetMappifier that you can use to convert the rows in the ResultSet into Row objects.
      Returns:
      A ResultSetMappifier that you can use to convert the rows in the ResultSet into Row objects.

    • getBeanifier

      public <T> ResultSetBeanifier<T> getBeanifier(Class<T> beanClass)
      Executes the query and returns a ResultSetBeanifier that you can use to convert the rows in the ResultSet into JavaBeans.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the JavaBeans
      Parameters:
      beanClass - The class of the JavaBeans
      Returns:
      A ResultSetBeanifier that you can use to convert the rows in the ResultSet into JavaBeans.

    • getBeanifier

      public <T> ResultSetBeanifier<T> getBeanifier(Class<T> beanClass, Supplier<T> beanSupplier)
      Executes the query and returns a ResultSetBeanifier that you can use to convert the rows in the ResultSet into JavaBeans.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the JavaBeans
      Parameters:
      beanClass - The class of the JavaBeans
      beanSupplier - The supplier of the JavaBean instances
      Returns:
      A ResultSetBeanifier that you can use to convert the rows in the ResultSet into JavaBeans.

      public void close()
